issue.title: Build a Splitwise Clone - Expense Sharing App
issue.body:
## Splitwise Clone - Expense Sharing Web App

Build a full-stack expense sharing application similar to Splitwise with Next.js, authentication, and SQLite database.

## Core Features

### 1. Authentication
- Sign up with email/password
- Login/logout
- Session management with JWT stored in httpOnly cookies
- Protected routes

### 2. Groups
- Create expense groups (e.g., "Roommates", "Trip to Paris")
- Add/remove members to groups
- View group balances

### 3. Expenses
- Add expenses to a group
- Split equally or custom amounts
- Track who paid and who owes
- Add description and date

### 4. Balances & Settlements
- Calculate who owes whom
- Simplified debt (minimize transactions)
- Mark debts as settled

## Tech Stack

### Frontend (Next.js 14 App Router)
- `/` - Landing page
- `/login`, `/signup` - Auth pages
- `/dashboard` - User dashboard with groups
- `/groups/[id]` - Group detail with expenses
- `/groups/new` - Create group
- Tailwind CSS for styling

### Backend (Next.js API Routes)
- `POST /api/auth/signup` - Register
- `POST /api/auth/login` - Login (returns JWT cookie)
- `POST /api/auth/logout` - Logout
- `GET /api/auth/me` - Current user
- `GET/POST /api/groups` - List/create groups
- `GET/PUT/DELETE /api/groups/[id]` - Group CRUD
- `POST /api/groups/[id]/members` - Add member
- `GET/POST /api/groups/[id]/expenses` - Expenses
- `GET /api/groups/[id]/balances` - Calculate balances
- `POST /api/groups/[id]/settle` - Settle debt

### Database (SQLite with better-sqlite3)
```sql
-- Users
CREATE TABLE users (
  id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
  email TEXT UNIQUE NOT NULL,
  password_hash TEXT NOT NULL,
  name TEXT NOT NULL,
  created_at DATETIME DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);

-- Groups
CREATE TABLE groups (
  id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
  name TEXT NOT NULL,
  created_by INTEGER REFERENCES users(id),
  created_at DATETIME DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);

-- Group Members
CREATE TABLE group_members (
  group_id INTEGER REFERENCES groups(id),
  user_id INTEGER REFERENCES users(id),
  PRIMARY KEY (group_id, user_id)
);

-- Expenses
CREATE TABLE expenses (
  id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
  group_id INTEGER REFERENCES groups(id),
  paid_by INTEGER REFERENCES users(id),
  amount REAL NOT NULL,
  description TEXT,
  created_at DATETIME DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);

-- Expense Splits
CREATE TABLE expense_splits (
  expense_id INTEGER REFERENCES expenses(id),
  user_id INTEGER REFERENCES users(id),
  amount REAL NOT NULL,
  PRIMARY KEY (expense_id, user_id)
);

-- Settlements
CREATE TABLE settlements (
  id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
  group_id INTEGER REFERENCES groups(id),
  from_user INTEGER REFERENCES users(id),
  to_user INTEGER REFERENCES users(id),
  amount REAL NOT NULL,
  created_at DATETIME DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);
```

## File Structure
```
app/
  layout.tsx
  page.tsx (landing)
  login/page.tsx
  signup/page.tsx
  dashboard/page.tsx
  groups/
    [id]/page.tsx
    new/page.tsx
  api/
    auth/
      signup/route.ts
      login/route.ts
      logout/route.ts
      me/route.ts
    groups/
      route.ts
      [id]/
        route.ts
        members/route.ts
        expenses/route.ts
        balances/route.ts
        settle/route.ts
lib/
  db.ts (database init & queries)
  auth.ts (JWT helpers, password hashing)
  balances.ts (debt calculation logic)
components/
  Navbar.tsx
  GroupCard.tsx
  ExpenseForm.tsx
  BalanceChart.tsx
middleware.ts (auth middleware)
```

## Setup Files
- package.json (next, react, better-sqlite3, bcryptjs, jose)
- tsconfig.json
- tailwind.config.ts
- next.config.js
- .gitignore
